result.execSummary:
The defendant James Willie Baskin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, James Willie Baskin was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James Willie Baskin is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • James Willie Baskin was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • James Willie Baskin was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • James Willie Baskin was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.

Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

-Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
-Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No contact with the victim, Minnie C.. May be modified after completion of 1/2 the sentence. Any violation may result in additional charges;
No firearms; weapons.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

timeConds.notes: No release privileges. Court will allow good time credit.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions apply as to Counts 2 and 4.
Concurrent with:

Same conditions apply as to Counts 2 and 3.

records.addlTxt: Scanned Sealed Jury Questions.vmb

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant James Willie Baskin in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing. 

COUNT 2 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 42 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of  initial confinement.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

COUNT 3 & 4 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 42 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of  initial confinement.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS
   in the House of Correction.  No release privileges.  Court will allow Good time credit.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling, and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim, Minnie C.  Maybe modified after completion of 1/2 the sentence.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
At the hour of 1:45 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1 and GUILTY as to Counts 2, 3 and 4, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for aquittal as to Count 1 and judgment as to Counts 2, 3 and 4 on the verdict and granted defense's motion for aquittal as to Count 1 and denied defense's motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to Counts 2, 3 and 4.  Court ordered entry of judgment of acquittal as to Count 1 and judgment of conviction as to Counts 2, 3 and 4.  Defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  No PSI ordered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Benjamin Lindsay on behalf of Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury trial continued.  Case recalled at 1:20 pm.  Jury question placed on the record.  Written response submitted to the jury.

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury trial continued. Jury resumed deliberations at 9:25 am.

Case recalled at 11:20 am.  Jury question placed on the record.  Jury in the box at 11:24 am.  Supplemental instruction read and provided to the jury.  Jury out of the box at 11:26 am.
Exhibit list received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 38. PM session.
Jury trial resumed.  Case recalled at 1:16 pm.
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.  Court discussed jury instructions with parties.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box at 1:20 pm.  State's motion to briefly reopen their case granted by the Court.  On state's motion, signed stipulation read to the jury.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Closing instructions on the law.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  State's rebuttal arguments.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:05 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputies Arredondo and Zielski who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Court discussed with parties which exhibits jurors would be allowed to have in the jury room if needed.

Case back on the record at 4:38 pm.  Jury notes placed on the record.  Jury in the box at 4:41 pm.  Court excused jury for the evening with instructions to return at 9:00 am on 11/6/15.  Jury out of the box at 4:43 pm.

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 38. AM session.
Jury trial resumed.  Case recalled at 9:30 am.  Court addressed issue regarding witness testimony.  Jury in the box at 9:57 am.  Witness Conrad C. resworn and direct examination resumed.  Exhibits 1-4 offered into evidence by state and received by the Court.  Exhibit 5 offered into evidence by defense and received by the Court.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Officer Damon Wilcox and Milwaukee Police Department Officer Michael Gasser on direct examination.  Exhibits 6-9 marked and offered into evidence by state and received by the Court.  Exhibit 10 marked.  Exhibits 11-15 marked and offered into evidence by state and received by the Court.  Cross examination of state's witness.  Re-direct of state's witness.  Court took brief break for state to check on status of next witnesses.  Jury out of the box.  State reports that she is prepared to proceed with next witness. Jury in the box at 11:14 am.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Forensic Investigator Chet St. Clair and Controlled Substance Analyst Jeff Zwickey (Wisconsin State Crime Lab) on direct examination.  Exhibits 16 marked and offered into evidence by state and received by the Court.  Exhibit 10 offered into evidence by state and received by the Court.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Court released jury for lunch with instructions to return at 1:30 pm.  Jury out of the box at 11:36 am.  Court to continue colloquy regarding right to testify with defendant after lunch.
Stipulation received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury list received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 38.

P.M.
Amended information filed DISMISSING COUNT 1.

Parties addressed several trial issues.  Defense does not offer or agree to any stipulation as to the nature of the substance or any prior convictions.  State to call a analyst.  Defense stipulate to the felony conviction.   Court to hold colloquy with defendant regarding relevant conviction, after voir dire.

Jury panel in court and sworn at 2:02. 
Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:07.  Jury out of box.  Court held private voir dire with juror #29.  Strike for cause done on the record.  Jury in box.  Continued voir dire with juror #22.  Sidebar held.  

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Court held colluquy with the defendant regarding the stipulation.  Court finds the defendant agrees with the stipulation.

Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  
Jury in box. 
Court instructed the jury on Opening Instructions on the law.
Opening statements by state and defense.  
  
Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Minnie C. on direct examination.  Cross examination of State's witness.  Sworn for the State:  Conrad C. on direct examination.  Jury out of box.  Court placed sidebar on the record.  Trial to resume 11/5/2015 at 9:30am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Amended information, received and filed, DISMISSING COUNT 5, Maintain Drug Trafficing Place, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.42(1).

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

CASE SET IN ERROR ON AUGUST 7, 2015, BRANCH 38 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION.

COUNT #4: POSSESSION OF THC (TETRAHYDROCANNABINOLS) - 2ND AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 961.41(3g)(e) and 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.   mld

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Matt Last.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant, as to COUNTS #1, #2, #3, #4 and #5.    

Information adds drug charges that were dismissed at the Inital Appearance on 5-28-2015.  Defense has no objection to COUNTS #3 and #4 on the Information.  Discovery, including a revised offer was provided to defense counsel, per the State.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-7-2015 at 8:30 am. 

Victim, Minnie C., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification of the no contact order.  

All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Minnie C. or Conrad C., no guns in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Court ordered defendant to have no contact with Minnie C. or Conrad C.   mld

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Minnie C. or Conrad C., no weapons and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.    mld

Defendant James Willie Baskin in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant James Willie Baskin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defense moves to dismiss Counts 3 & 4 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS Defense's motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense WITHHELD plea as to Count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
